Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Cortical maps revealed severe gray - matter deficits in the cingulate , limbic , and paralimbic cortices of MA abusers ( averaging 11 . 3 % below control ; p < 0 . 05 ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Gray matter |
| Cingulate cortices |
| Limbic cortices |
| Paralimbic cortices |

These are the chemical entities mentioned in the paragraph. However, please note that "gray matter" is not a chemical in the traditional sense, but rather a type of brain tissue. It is included here for completeness as it is the specific type of tissue that is deficient in the cortices mentioned.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Gray matter |
| Cingulate cortices |
| Limbic cortices |
| Paralimbic cortices |

These are the chemical entities mentioned in the paragraph. "Gray matter" is a type of neural tissue that contains the bodies of neurons and their processes, and is rich in axons, dendrites, and neuropil. It is included here as it is the specific type of tissue that is deficient in the cortices mentioned. The other entities mentioned, "cingulate cortices," "limbic cortices," and "paralimbic cortices," are specific types of brain tissue located in different regions of the brain.
